result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen C Solberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant is authorized to keep his employment in the State of Michigan.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be performed at no less than 8 hours every six months.

supervisions.notes:
The Court has no objections to the defendant serving this sentence in Florence County as long as no cost to Forest County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).

The defendant is eligible for huber and good time.
Consecutive to: Florence County Case #17CF32

Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

Huber and good time allowed.
Concurrent with: Count #1 but consecutive to Florence County Case #17CF32.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to jail

Defendant Stephen C Solberg in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Stephen C Solberg in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:28 AM. State - here for SEHR. Judge Habeck appears via video from Shawano County Circuit Court Branch1. Court puts on the record that he has received and reviewed letters of recommendation in regards to the defendant. Court makes sure the defendant knows that he has a right to have the Judge appear in person. Solberg has no objections to Judge Habeck appearing via video from Shawano County for this proceeding and Solberg states that he can see and hear the Judge. State - has revocation summary - finds no errors or ommissions - makes recommendation prior to sentencing - recommends 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other - credit for 64 days (stipulated). Scholke makes argument prior to recommendation - makes statement in regards to sentence credit (has 109 days credit but that includes Florence County) - asks that the defendant be able to serve his sentence in Florence County for stated reasons - agrees with the recommendation as given by the State of the 6 months on each count, concurrent to each other, with credit for 64 days. Solberg makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - 6 months in FC jail - can serve the sentence in Florence County as long as at no cost to either County - concurrent to each other but consecutive to Florence Case #17CF32- credit for 64 days - huber and good time allowed, right to appeal, reminds of felony rights, adjourned at 11:40 AM.
Character Reference Letters
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 6, 2018 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stephen C Solberg in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:05 PM. Court has plea questionnaire, indicates a G plea to count #1 as alleged and #3 as alleged, counts #2 and #4 are to be DRI. State agrees. Court goes over what DRI means. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea thru the PLQ and rights to JT, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence, both co unts - place on probation for 2 years  - concurrent to each other - with conditions of: 35 hours of CS, AODA and follow thru, continuation order to allow the defendant to maintain his employment outside of WI (works in Michigan), costs; on count #3 - same conditions plus a $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges. Schultz and Solberg agree. Schultz makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. State - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Solberg makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #1 - $10.00 fine plus costs - paid at $100.00/month commencing 1/2/17/CO, count #3 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid at same rate as count #1, AODA and follow thru, 35 hours of community service - to be performed no less than 8 hours every 6 months, submit DNA, authorizes his employment in the State of Michigan, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court makes statement in regards to expert testimony.  Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stephen C Solberg in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:06 PM. Schultz - waiver of PH today. Solberg agrees. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Schultz has Information, waives reading of it, would like a week or two to investigate matters and inform his client of the right to substitution, asking Court to schedule matter for ARGN. Court denies extension and goes into recess at 2:09 PM to allow Schultz time to fill out request for substitution. Back on record at 2:14 with same appearances. Court has been handed a request for substitution, accepts it as timely, notice will be sent when a Judge is assigned.

Court sets for AIA and gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney. State - bond - $5000 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol. Court so ordrers.
